fridaExcelReadersSyntaxWrite.Name: ExcelWrite
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxWrite.Description: Write something in a given cell in a worksheet. ColRow can take values such as A1, D15, etc. RowIndex and colIndex must take numerical values and it starts from 1, or either 'lastrow' or 'lastcol'. Format will be applied to the cell after writting the text. Original format is mainly intended for dates, to identify the origin date parts in the text. Excel formats are different from this, refer to https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-stringsfor further information.
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxWrite.Parameters: something, worksheetKey, ColRow, rowIndex, colIndex, format, originalFormat
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxWrite.Syntax3: Write <something> in <worksheetKey> cell <ColRow> with format <format> source <originalFormat>
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxWrite.Example2: Write '05/07/202' in hoja1 cell E1 with format dd/mm/yyyy
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxWrite.Example3: Write '05-07-2020 14:10' in hoja1 cell E1 with format dd/mm/yyyy hh:mm source dd-MM-yyyy hh:mm
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxWrite.Example4: Write '115' in hoja1 cell F3 with format[Red][< 100]0;[Blue] [>=100]0
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxWrite.Example5: Write '12345678' in hoja1 cell F1 with format #,###.00
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxWrite.Example6: Write 'Nombres' in hoja1 row 1 and column 5
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxWrite.Example7: Write 'Nombres' in hoja1 row lastrow and column lastcol

fridaExcelReadersSyntaxRemoveDuplicate.Name: RemoveDuplicate
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxRemoveDuplicate.Description: Removes the duplicate rows from a given sheet. When many column indexes are specified, the deletion will be based on the repetition of values in all those columns. Indexes start with 1.
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxRemoveDuplicate.Example3: RemoveDuplicates from WSheet1 at [1] with_header Y

fridaExcelReadersSyntaxNewWorkbook.Name: NewWorkbook
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxNewWorkbook.Description: Creates a new Workbook in a path where the client wants (only creates file of type 'xlsx'). You CANNOT use special characters that Windows does NOT allow. WorkbookName is also saved as a variable. 'Create i' syntax will save the workbook without saving a variable.

fridaExcelReadersSyntaxSortColumns.Name: SortColumns
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxSortColumns.Description: Sort by a Column. Maximum 3 columns to sort in a worksheet. Order direction must be set (ascending/descending). If header is Yes, it will not sort the first value, since it considers it to be a header.
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxSortColumns.Syntax2: SortColumns in <worksheetKey> in usedRange by columns {<colindex|order1>, <colindex2|order2>, <colindex3|order3>} header <isHeader> -Function still under development
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxSortColumns.Example1: SortColumns in WSName1 by column {10} ascending header Yes
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxSortColumns.Example2: SortColumns in WSName1 in UsedRange by columns {1/ascending,2/descending,3/descending} header Yes
fridaExcelReadersSyntaxSortColumns.Example3: SortColumns in WSName1 in B10:D18 by columns {1/asc,2/desc} header No
